adjectives.description: orderly (comparative more orderly, superlative most orderly)

examples: He has always kept an orderly kitchen, with nothing out of place.
We live in an orderly universe, where rules govern both the movements of planets and the binding of molecules.
An orderly gathering of citizens stood on the corner awaiting the bus.

entries.meaning: Being on duty; keeping order; conveying orders.

adverbs.description: orderly (comparative more orderly, superlative most orderly)

entries.meaning: (now rare) According to good order or practice; appropriately, in a well-behaved or orderly (adjective) way. [from 15th c.]
(obsolete) In order; in a particular order or succession; with a suitable arrangement. [15th–19th c.]
examples: The earth from heaven, the sea from earth, he parted orderly, / And from the thicke and foggie ayre, he tooke the lightsome skie.

entries.meaning: A hospital attendant given a variety of non-medical duties.
(military) A soldier who carries out minor tasks for a superior officer.
